action.content:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: skiing, jacks, socks, bronze, vest, platinum, train, gun, hockey.
Your opponent's team words are: ska, tequila, wine, alternative, martini, kale, zucchini, rock.
Distractor words are: guitar, plum, lime, banana, apricot, cello, harmonica.
The kill words are: hiv.
action.label: context

action.content:
<reasoning>
Let's tackle this clue-giving problem. The user's team has words: skiing, jacks, socks, bronze, vest, platinum, train, gun, hockey. The opponent's words are ska, tequila, wine, alternative, martini, kale, zucchini, rock. Distractors are guitar, plum, lime, banana, apricot, cello, harmonica. The kill word is hiv.

First, I need to find a single-word clue that relates to as many of the user's team words as possible. The clue can't be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them. The challenge is to find a word that connects several of these terms semantically.

Looking at the user's words: skiing, jacks, socks, bronze, vest, platinum, train, gun, hockey. Let's see possible connections. 

Skiing and hockey are sports. Bronze and platinum are metals. Vest and jacks might be clothing or tools. Socks and train could be different. Gun is a weapon. Maybe metals (bronze, platinum) and vest (could relate to armor, which is metal). Skiing and hockey might relate to cold weather or sports. Jacks could be the tool (like a jack-in-the-box or lifting jacks) or the children's game. Socks and train: maybe "train" as in a train of thought, but that's a stretch. Alternatively, "
action.label: response

content.message: Your answer contained more than two lines, please only give one clue and your targets on two separate lines.
